summary: An email from attorney Martin G. Weinberg to an unspecified recipient, requesting copies of the sealed indictment and any search warrants for Jeffrey Epstein's property. Weinberg asserts his legal representation of Epstein and requests that seized materials not be reviewed until attorney-client privilege concerns can be addressed.

persons.name: Martin G. Weinberg
persons.context: Attorney representing Jeffrey Epstein, sending an email to request confidential legal documents and to assert attorney-client privilege over materials that may be seized from Epstein's property.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as 'Mr. Epstein,' the subject of a sealed indictment and potential search warrants. He is identified as being actively represented by Martin G. Weinberg and other attorneys.

connections.description: Weinberg states he has been actively representing Epstein legally and is acting to protect privileged communications from seizure.

events.title: Attorney Request for Sealed Documents
events.description: Martin G. Weinberg sends an email requesting copies of the sealed indictment against Jeffrey Epstein and any search warrants for his property.

locations: 20 Park Plaza Boston, MA 02116 (Law office of Martin G. Weinberg)
keyFacts: A sealed indictment existed against Jeffrey Epstein as of July 7, 2019.
Search warrants for Epstein's residence or property were anticipated or had been issued.
Attorney Martin G. Weinberg was actively representing Epstein and sought to prevent review of seized materials to protect attorney-client privilege.
The communication emphasizes the confidentiality of the legal proceedings and the privileged nature of potential evidence.
